Description: Carved and painted polychrome wooden shabti of Nbt pr ʿy-y with a black lappet-wig, a modelled white face with black and white eyes and red lips, two red neck-creases, a red, black and white collar, a black body and joined yellow hands holding two yellow hoes; the leg section is inscribed with Chapter 6 of the Book of The Dead in five rows of yellow painted Hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with a yellow painted representation of a seed-basket hanging down the back of one arm.
